div.pre: 642 Siderokastro, Macedonia, 1961 Burial: c. 90 B.C. (T) Contents: c. 400-500 AR LEG MAKEΔΟΝΩΝ: tetradr. (some) Aesillas: tetradr. (hundreds) Athens: 100+ New Style tetradr. (latest on record 136 B.C.) Disposition: Athens 6 (2 Aesillas, 4 Athens); casts, photos of 44 Aesillas and 3 Athens in ANS Varoucha, A Delt 1961-2, Chronika, p. 4 † Thompson, NC 1962, pp. 319-20 Almost certainly a combined deposit; the Leg Makedonon and Athens coins taken from circulation c. 130-125 and the Aesillas pieces added to the hd. some forty years later. Inquiries in Macedonia by an Athenian corre- spondent provided the information that the find originally included about 500 coins, of which one-quarter to one- third were Athenian. The fdc Aesillas coins appearing in numerous European and American sales catalogues from 1961 on undoubtedly came from Siderokastro
